net.jforum.dao

Interface UserDAO

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenericUserDAO, HsqldbUserDAO, OracleUserDAO, SqlServer2000UserDAO, SqlServerUserDAO

    public interface UserDAO
    Model interface for User. This interface defines methods which are expected to be implementd by a specific data access driver. The intention is to provide all functionality needed to update, insert, delete and select some specific data.
    Author:
    Rafael Steil

        User selectById(int userId)
        Gets a specific User.
        Parameters:
        userId - The User ID to search
        Returns:
        Userobject containing all the information
        See Also:
        selectAll()

      • selectByName

        User selectByName(String username)
        Gets a specific User.
        Parameters:
        username - The User name to search
        Returns:
        User object containing all the information or null if no data was found.
        See Also:
        selectAll()

      • selectAll

        List selectAll()
        Gets all users
        Returns:
        ArrayList with the users. Each entry is an User object

      • selectAllWithKarma

        List selectAllWithKarma()
        Gets all users with your Karma.
        Returns:
        List with the users. Each entry is an User object (with the KarmaStatus populated).

      • selectAllByGroup

        List selectAllByGroup(int groupId,
                    int start,
                    int count)
        Gets all users from a specific group.
        Parameters:
        groupId - The group id
        start - The index position to start fetching
        count - The total number of records to fetch
        Returns:
        List with the users. Each entry is an User object

      • selectAllWithKarma

        List selectAllWithKarma(int startFrom,
                      int count)
        Gets all users
        Parameters:
        startFrom - Index to start fetching from
        count - Number of records to retrieve
        Returns:
        ArrayList with the users. Each entry is an User object (with the KarmaStatus populated).

      • findByName

        List findByName(String input,
              boolean exactMath)
        Finds an user by matching an input string.
        Parameters:
        input - The username to search. May be part of the username. The method will match all users who have the input string as part of their usernames.
        exactMath - Set to true to get the user data related to the username passed as argument, and set it to false to search all users who match the criteria.
        Returns:
        List with the found users. Each entry is an User object, where only the id and username members are filled.

      • selectAll

        List selectAll(int startFrom,
             int count)
        Gets all users
        Parameters:
        startFrom - Index to start fetching from
        count - Number of records to retrieve
        Returns:
        ArrayList with the users. Each entry is an User object

      • delete

        void delete(int userId)
        Deletes an user.
        Parameters:
        userId - The user ID to delete
        See Also:
        undelete(int)

      • undelete

        void undelete(int userId)
        Undeletes an user. The system allows user undeletation because when you call delete(int) the user isn't fisically deleted of the database, but just marked as deleted. This is done to ensure data integrity.
        Parameters:
        userId - The user ID to undelete
        See Also:
        delete(int)

      • update

        void update(User user)
        Updates a user.
        Parameters:
        user - Reference to a User object to update

      • addNew

        int addNew(User user)
        Adds a new User. After successfuly persisting the data, this method shoud call user.setId(theNewId);, as well return the new user id.
        Parameters:
        user - Reference to a valid and configured User object
        Returns:
        The new user id

      • addNewWithId

        void addNewWithId(User user)
        Adds a new user with a predefined user id (added by Pieter for external login support)
        Parameters:
        user - Reference to a valid and configured User object, with the user id already set

      • setActive

        void setActive(int userId,
             boolean active)
        Set the active status. An user with the active status equals to false cannot be considered a "oficial", "fully registered" user until its status is set to true. This is interesting when you want to request user confirmation about registrations, for example
        Parameters:
        userId - The user ID to change the status
        active - true or false

      • setRanking

        void setRanking(int userId,
              int rankingId)
        Sets the ranking.
        Parameters:
        userId - The user ID
        rankingId - int

        Increments the number of posts of the user.
        Parameters:
        userId - The user ID to increment the number of posts

      • decrementPosts

        void decrementPosts(int userId)
        Decrement the number of posts of some user.
        Parameters:
        userId - The user ID do decrement the number of posts.

      • getLastUserInfo

        User getLastUserInfo()
        Gest some piece of information of the last user registered
        Returns:
        HashMap containing the information. The map has two keys:
      • userName: The username
      • userId: The user's ID

      • isUsernameRegistered

        boolean isUsernameRegistered(String username)
        Checks the existence of some username. This method is used to ensure that will not be two equal usernames in the database.
        Parameters:
        username - The username to verify
        Returns:
        true or false, if the user was found or not, respectively

                 String password)
        Validates the user login.
        Parameters:
        username - The username
        password - The password
        Returns:
        The user object if the provided information was corret, null if the information was invalid

        groupId - The group id to remove the user from

      • writeLostPasswordHash

        void writeLostPasswordHash(String email,
                         String hash)
        Stores the "lost password" security hash, that was generated when the user asked the system to get a reminder of his password. This hash is used to ensure the information supplied.
        Parameters:
        email - The user email
        hash - The hash to store.

      • validateLostPasswordHash

        boolean validateLostPasswordHash(String email,
                               String hash)
        Validate the provided security hash against the data stored in our system.
        Parameters:
        email - The user email
        hash - The supplied security hash
        Returns:
        true if the data matches ok, of false if it is invalid

      • saveNewPassword

        void saveNewPassword(String password,
                   String email)
        Writes a new password for the user.
        Parameters:
        password - The new password
        email - The user email

      • getUsernameByEmail

        String getUsernameByEmail(String email)
        Gets the username related to the email
        Parameters:
        email - The email to search for the username
        Returns:
        The username, if found, or an empty String

      • validateActivationKeyHash

        boolean validateActivationKeyHash(int userId,
                                String hash)
        Validate if the activated key matches the one in the database
        Parameters:
        userId - Which user to validate the activation key?
        hash - The activation key
        Returns:
        true if the data matches ok, of false if it is invalid

      • writeUserActive

        void writeUserActive(int userId)
        Set user account to active
        Parameters:
        userId - Which user account to set active?

      • updateUsername

        void updateUsername(int userId,
                  String username)
        Updates only the username. This method generally will be used in implementations of net.jforum.drivers.external.LoginAuthenticator to update usernames which changed in the external source and therefore should be updated in jforum's users table.
        Parameters:
        userId - The user's id related to the username to update
        username - The new username to write

      • hasUsernameChanged

        boolean hasUsernameChanged(int userId,
                         String usernameToCheck)
        Check if the username passed as argument is different of the username existent in the database.
        Parameters:
        userId - The user's id to work with
        usernameToCheck - The username to compare with the existing one in jforum_users
        Returns:
        true if the usernames are different.

      • saveUserAuthHash

        void saveUserAuthHash(int userId,
                    String hash)
        Saves the user-specific security hash to the database
        Parameters:
        userId - the user id to save
        hash - the security hash
